title: Daily reminder that the ARAM Poppy build should be looked at
body:
If you've ever gotten Poppy in ARAM (which is fairly common since she's 450 IP) you will see that the recommended items for poppy go a little something like this

{{item:3096}} In First items, understandable since it's hard for Poppy to farm without getting shit on

But then they recommend you buy {{item:3098}} afterwards

What? Okay, well maybe they see that you don't need to get all that extra passive gold anymore, sure you probably wont ever use the passive effectively but the slow from {{item:3092}} *is* pretty good.

And then they recommend you buy {{item:3069}} AFTER you bought {{item:3098}} and sold {{item:3096}} 

Seriously Riot, who is in charge of making these recommended item builds? This is almost if not worse than the time Poppy still had 6 {{item:2003}} in her Recommended Build. I know you don't want Poppy to be strong but this is not the way to do it.

Several champions' recommended items were never cleaned up properly after the S4 support item changes, including reworking Shurelia's and Kage's into support items, which made them conflict with each other.

I do think one support item can be good on ARAM, because they're designed to be valuable in lanes where there is another champion in lane and you're not getting most of the CS, both of which have 100% chance to be true in ARAM.  But Poppy would probably be better off pursuing the shield line instead of *either* of those; if she wants an active speedup (besides the one in her kit, that is) she can get Guardian's Horn or Righteous Glory (if it is buildable on ARAM).

Probably a holdover from when those items were stackable gp10 items and carries stacked gold income so they could snowball faster (like philo stone+Kage's lucky pick+heart of gold+Avarice blade).

Picking up a nomads on Aram Poppy isn't half bad though, because it allows you to keep up in gold really well and get bigger items sooner. The active on Talisman is also VERY good on ARAM because you can only run in two directions: forwards and backwards, and Poppy loves going fast.

That and "every item is viable on Poppy"—Phreak 2014.
